description: The metadata describing the carrier integration

Id.description: The id for this integration **(this GUID should not be changed after publishing)**

Name.description: The name of this integration, used for internal purposes, can be the same as the branded Carrier in Carriers[]

AuthProcess.description: The specification for authorizing with this carrier. Only specify if using OAuth

Identifier.description: Identify the type of Auth being used by the integration

AuthenticationType.description: Identify the type of Auth being used by the integration

IsSandbox.description: Indicates whether or not the authentication server is sandboxed

access_token.description: Added to allow oauth 1.0 to work

url_template.description: The url to obtain the temporary Access (aka Request) Token to start a flow

authorization.description: Authorization: the beginning of an OAuth2.0 flow that ensures the user is logged in and approves access to the Resource

url_template.description: The url to obtain the access token using the authorization code on the backend `https://carrier.com/oauth/authorize`

query_parameters.description: A list of query parameters that will be attached to the url

value.description: The value associated with the parameter

method.description: The http method to use when making the server-server code for token request `GET`, `POST`

body.description: A list of query parameters that will be attached to the url

value.description: The value associated with the parameter

headers.description: A list of header values that will be sent to request the token

value.description: The value associated with the parameter

name.description: A nonce query parameter included on the accept request, then returned and validated on the redirect request

url_template.description: The url to obtain the access token using the authorization code on the backend `https://carrier.com/oauth/authorize`

query_parameters.description: A list of query parameters that will be attached to the url

value.description: The value associated with the parameter

method.description: The http method to use when making the server-server code for token request `GET`, `POST`

body.description: A list of query parameters that will be attached to the url

value.description: The value associated with the parameter

headers.description: A list of header values that will be sent to request the token

value.description: The value associated with the parameter

name.description: A nonce query parameter included on the accept request, then returned and validated on the redirect request

access_token.description: JSONPath to the JSON element for access_token

token_type.description: JSONPath to the JSON element for token_type

refresh_token.description: JSONPath to the JSON element for refresh_token

expires_in.description: JSONPath to the JSON element for expires_in. Mutually exclusive with expires_at

expires_at.description: Configuration for parsing a date-time, when the integration is lacking expires_in

path.description: JSONPath to the JSON element containing the date-time

date_time_format.description: DateTime format string compliant with [Microsoft Datetime Format String](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings)

connection_context.description: Optional collection of properties to include in the connection_context sent back with the auth flow result

request_token.description: Request Token: server-server code for token exchange

url_template.description: The url to obtain the access token using the authorization code on the backend `https://carrier.com/oauth/authorize`

query_parameters.description: A list of query parameters that will be attached to the url

value.description: The value associated with the parameter

method.description: The http method to use when making the server-server code for token request `GET`, `POST`

body.description: A list of query parameters that will be attached to the url

value.description: The value associated with the parameter

headers.description: A list of header values that will be sent to request the token

value.description: The value associated with the parameter

name.description: A nonce query parameter included on the accept request, then returned and validated on the redirect request

access_token.description: JSONPath to the JSON element for access_token

token_type.description: JSONPath to the JSON element for token_type

refresh_token.description: JSONPath to the JSON element for refresh_token

expires_in.description: JSONPath to the JSON element for expires_in. Mutually exclusive with expires_at

expires_at.description: Configuration for parsing a date-time, when the integration is lacking expires_in

path.description: JSONPath to the JSON element containing the date-time

date_time_format.description: DateTime format string compliant with [Microsoft Datetime Format String](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings)

connection_context.description: Optional collection of properties to include in the connection_context sent back with the auth flow result

refresh_token.description: Refresh Token: server-server refresh token exchange for access token **NOTE: sometimes a new RT is also created**

AccountModals.description: This defines the connection modal and the settings modals in the ui, along with branded images

RegistrationFormSchema.description: A form that allows the user to connect to the service. This form will usually prompt for an account number and login credentials

SettingsFormSchema.description: A form that allows the user update their connection settings, such as when a password is changed

PackageTypes.description: A list of package types associated with this branded carrier

Id.description: The unique identifier for this package type. **It should not change after being published**

Name.description: The name of this package type ex: `'Eco friendly box'`

ApiCode.description: The identifier for this package type to be used in API calls. Must be snake cased and unique.

CarrierPackageTypeCode.description: This is the code that will be sent to requests, this should be the same code the carrier's api would expect

Description.description: This is a human readable description about what the packaging is

Abbreviation.description: This is an abbreviation of the name if necessary

RequiredToShip.description: What information is required to ship this package type

ConfirmationTypes.description: The confirmation types associated with this service

ServiceAttributes.description: A list of attributes about this service

SupportedCountries.description: A list of countries supported by this service

SupportedLabelSizes.description: A list of label sizes supported by this service

LabelCode.description: The label code associated with this shipping service

International.description: Indicates whether or not this service is for international or domestic use

Code.description: This is the code that will be sent to requests, this should be the same code the carrier's api would expect

Abbreviation.description: This is an abbreviation of the name, can match the name if it is short enough

Name.description: The name of this shipping service ex: `'Overnight Guarantee'`

ApiCode.description: The identifier for this shipping service to be used in API calls. Must be snake cased and unique

Id.description: The unique identifier for this shipping service. **It should not change after being published**

ShippingServices.description: A list of shipping services associated with this branded carrier

alcohol.description: This object defines which shipping options should be made available and what those shipping options should be called in the ui

FromCountry.description: The 2 character ISO country code ex: `US`, `MX`, `FR`

AlternateServiceName.description: An optional name for this service based on the countries branding

DefaultSupportedCountries.description: A list of supported countries, used to determine which services are visible based on shipstation sellers home country

DefaultLabelSizes.description: This provides a list of supported label sizes by the carrier

LabelFormats.description: This provides a list of label formats supported by the carrier

DefaultConfirmationTypes.description: This dictionary allows you to specify which supported delivery confirmation types the carrier offers. A minimum of 1 confirmation type is required. Setting one to undefined will use the default name in shipstation

TrackingUrl.description: This is the url template for static tracking pages ex: `http://www.shipper.com/tracking/{0}`

CarrierUrl.description: This is the url to the carriers website

Description.description: This is a human readable description of the branded carrier

Name.description: The name of this branded carrier, this is what is seen by the customer

ApiCode.description: The identifier for this carrier to be used in API calls. Must be snake cased and unique

Id.description: The id for this branded carrier **(this GUID should not be changed after publishing)**

Icon.description: This is the full file path to the branded icon

Logo.description: This is the full file path to the branded logo

Images.description: This defines a list of images associated with this branded carrier

RequiresLabelPayment.description: Indicates whether the carrier requires the label be purchased on calling create label

NativeRating.description: If this carrier uses Native Rating, details about the connection

DefaultRateCardId.description: Default rate card to use for rating

Path.description: Path to rating logic and rate card data for this carrier

RateCards.description: Array of rate cards for the carrier

items.description: Configuration for a given rate card

Currency.description: Currency of the rate card. This uses the three-digit currency code format.

Id.description: Externally facing id of the rate card.

SupportsUserManagedRates.description: Can users manage their own rates

PackageRatingGroups.description: List of package rating groups for the carrier

items.description: Details about how packages are related to rates

CarrierPackageTypeCode.description: This is the code that will be sent to requests, this should be the same code the carrier's api would expect

DimensionLimits.description: Maximum allowable dimensions of packages for the rating group

Girth.description: Girth of the package as defined by the carrier

LengthPlusGirth.description: Length plus girth should not exceed this amount

NoTwoSides.description: No two sides exceed this amount

MaxWeight.description: Maximum allowable weight of packages for the rating group

Name.description: Name of the package rating group

PackageTypeId.description: Id of the package type to which this rating group corresponds

Zones.description: List of possible zones used by the carrier.

items.description: Basic details about a carrier zone

ApiCode.description: The identifier for this zone that could be used for rating keys. Must be snake cased and unique

Description.description: This is a human readable description about what the zone is

Name.description: The name of this zone ex: '1' or 'EU-3'
